comment: teacher has literally never answered any of my emails and refuses to check any of my work done and gives poor excuses like your file is collapsed even thought it works perfectly on different software and was given 3 different file formats,
I would definitely take this professor again. Taught us about AutoCAD and how to use it. Even explain the commands to us in his lecture. I would definitely take him again

Best professor for an intro to engr graphics course! As someone who never used CAD before, he makes learning the material fun with clever projects. Make sure to follow his videos to ace every project. Projects can take time, but he gives 1-3 weeks with no late submissions accepted. Only one quiz, no midterm, and a final project instead of an exam.

I will say this: some lectures are brief and vague and you have to do your own YouTube research.

However, the professor is awesome. I turned in an assignment late (after texting him) and he gave me full credit.

If you do the work you're pretty much guaranteed a 100 in this class. I came in with no CAD experience and left feeling confident

Online course. Prof. Young is very energetic, supportive, and wants his students to succeed. Very lenient grader, he just wants you to spend some time playing with AutoCAD, and he pushes creativity in your designs. 

Cons: Online lectures are relatively brief and not on a set schedule.
           The required textbook was never referenced once.

Professor Young is amazing. He gives students the freedom to explore SolidWorks, make mistakes, and learn the software. I've told ME friends at other schools what we did and they were blown away. You will leave this course well-prepared to brag on your SolidWorks skills. Some projects are time consuming, but you are given ample time to complete.
Great teacher who is also very nice and understanding.

YALL THIS MY MAN FRR I LOVE THIS MAN WITH ALL MY HEART. He literally pushed back a whole assignment because of me (and a few students) and told me he saw potential in my design and wanted to see the final look. He be hyping me up like I feel like im dat bih every time I receive a 100 on my assignments and a positive note hyping me up. Love dat men!

He's the best professor I've ever had, he's always smiling and tries his best to help us as much as he can, the class can be a little hard if you don't have any previous experience with solidworks but he always does his best to help. Projects were always easy and he's always understanding with late submissions. Great professor definitely recommend!
Fun classwork/ projects. Attendance is NOT mandatory, but he does not post all project rubrics online. If you do not show up to class, you will not pass.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Loved this professor! He is funny and very understanding, although he might not help you out 1v1, unlike his student assistants. Attend his lectures so you can ask questions since he tends to leave some things out. The class was graded off of 7 assignments including the final. You will not regret taking him!

He is a great professor and is super relaxed but just be careful because he is so relaxed that we only had 6 total assignments the entire semester. He is funny and he grades easy, his requirements are clear. He gives lectures on lots of CAD but you'll probably need to do some self learning to get full credit, he leaves some stuff out in lectures
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: He's a great guy who's super approachable at ALL times of day and will work with you through any issue. His grading is very flexible because there are a thousand ways for a CAD design to be right. If you are in the Honors College, do a contract with him, it's really easy. Only didn't get the A because I forgot to check back with a simple project.

Awesome, very lenient dude. The lectures are very straightforward. The autoCAD assignments can get a little hard, but he grades VERY easily, especially when he knows everyone struggled. Just do your best, and you will get a good grade.

He is the best engineering graphic design in KSU. he always gives a feedback on your assignments. You can get an easy A in this class. Every 2 weeks there is an assignment which is not too much work. But the only problem in this class is that sometimes you have to use YOUTUBE to learn some stuff about SolidWork other than that he is awesome.
